column4: i have a folder called test. test has 775, is owned by root and gentest, josh is a part of gentest but cant do anything to the dir test. any ideas?
does "groups" confirm that josh is member of gentest?
an josh can't touch foobar in there to create that file?
the test file was never created, do you want me to sudo and do it?
what happens if you touch foobar as josh in that dir?
groups confirms josh is in gentest and ls -ld test confirms root:gentest and 775?
if so and josh cant write in there it's badly broken
im logged in as josh atm, so if i use groups josh i get josh and gentest, but if i just use groups i get the long list of all the various half admin groups aswell
just groups includes the gentest group?
log out and back in and it will be fixed
you need to do that for group changes to take effect
